text.p: Penske Motorsports Inc said Tuesday it has proposed a merger with North Carolina Motor Speedway Inc in Rockingham, N.C.

Terms provide that each holder of North Carolina Motor Speedway stock would get either $14 in cash per share, or a complicated formula involving that number of shares of Penske stock equal to $18.61 multiplied by the shares of North Carolina Motor Speedway stock held, divided by $30.
Penske said it entered into a definitive option and voting agreement with Carrie DeWitt, who owns about 65 percent of North Carolina Motor Speedway.
DeWitt has agreed to vote her shares in favor of the merger and to exchange her shares in North Carolina Motor Speedway for shares of Penske if the mereger takes place.
North Carolina Motor Speedway is a one-mile oval track built in 1965.

Penske is a promoter and marketer of professional motorsports in the United States. Spokesmen were not immediately available to provide further details on the proposed merger or an aggregate value of the transaction.
